conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the velocity-time graph to determine the particle's position at t = 8 seconds by calculating the displacement.

The image shows a velocity-time graph with three segments: 0 to 3 seconds (velocity increases linearly from 0 to 2 m/s), 3 to 5 seconds (velocity constant at 2 m/s), 5 to 8 seconds (velocity decreases linearly from 2 to 0 m/s).
The particle starts at x = 5 meters at t = 0.
From t = 0 to t = 3, calculate displacement: Δx1 = ∫(0 to 3) 2t dt = 9 meters.
From t = 3 to t = 5, calculate displacement: Δx2 = ∫(3 to 5) 2 dt = 4 meters.
From t = 5 to t = 8, calculate displacement: Δx3 = ∫(5 to 8) -2(8-t) dt = 9 meters.
